intro: Arabis nova subsp. nova, commonly known as the New Zealand rock白菜, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in rocky or gravelly habitats and is often found in alpine or subalpine regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in New Zealand.
